div.p: Greetings. I received your letter or response to my question about the acceptance of Jews, which I had raised rather curiously. I regretted shortly after that I troubled you with such a matter, as I wrote in my recent letters to Mr. Gwalther and at the same time indicated what I think and conclude about this case, namely that you, with a good conscience, cannot voluntarily accept Jews for this reason alone, that they are blasphemous against our savior, and that openly, obstinately, and continuously.

All other reasons would not be significant enough for me to consider them to be rejected.
